byline.contributor: Griff Palmer contributed reporting. Kitty Bennett contributed research.
byline.original: By STEVE EDER and MICHAEL BARBARO

abstract: Review of documents reveals that during the 12 years his father George held elective office, Jeb Bush freely used his unique access to seek favors for allies, push his views and burnish his political profile; Bush translated his influence into an elaborate network of relationships that positioned him to become governor of Florida in 1998, and eventually top prospect for Republican nomination in 2016 presidential election.
lead_paragraph: For the 12 years that George Bush held national elective office, Jeb Bush used his unique access to seek favors and make suggestions, helping bolster his own nascent career.

headline.main: As Dynasty’s Son, Jeb Bush Used His Connections Freely

snippet: For the 12 years that George Bush held national elective office, Jeb Bush used his unique access to seek favors and make suggestions, helping bolster his own nascent career.
